item.title: Road surface, 12th October
item.description:
Park mead road is dangerously uneven and is cracking. Seems as though road is subsiding in parts and some parts are dangerously uneven and dips dangerous when driving. Not sure if this is causing damage to peoples homes on the street.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park Mead, Blendon, London

item.title: 10 street Lamps out, 11th October
item.description:
There are 10 street lamps out going up kings Highway SE18 8 on Wickes side going up to the cemetery And 2 on flat side opposite Wickes. The 8 on Wickes side is from 2nd lamp post from junction of Wickham street and kings Highway going up to lamp post past cemetery main gate These need to be sorted as it is very dark along kings Highway and NOT VERY SAFE
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 94, Kings Highway, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vegitation residents, 11th October

item.title: Bin Bags Full of Rendering and Rubble, 11th October
item.description:
Some renovation work took place on a house on the 26th June ‘25 and on each occasion the workmen cleared their stone and render and placed the rubble outside of the house along the alley way. The owner of the house where the rubble originated from should have arranged for the rubble to removed by the workmen or arranged for a skip to take it away. Instead the workmen / property owner has just left it strewn alongside the alleyway opposite their back garden gate. If we all took this approach then there would be no access or alleyway for the locals and it would be a serious hazard to animals elderly and kids. I’ve given them 3 months to clear it and the bags of render and rubble remain strewn across the either side of the alley way. It needs to be reported and removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Longmeadow Road, Longlands, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet
